TITLE: Exclusive: Analog Devices' $21 billion Maxim buy set for EU approval - source
DESCRIPTION: U.S. semi-conductor maker Analog Devices Inc (ADI) is set to gain unconditional European Union antitrust approval for its proposed $21 billion takeover of Maxim Integrated Products, a person familiar with the matter said.

TITLE: Forget labels, we're all one, says Grammy nominee Jon Batiste
DESCRIPTION: American musician Jon Batiste says he set out to break the confines of genre in his new album, mixing styles and working with the likes of gospel singer Mavis Staples, guitarist Cory Wong and author Zadie Smith.

TITLE: Dutch police says bomb threat at parliament was false alarm
DESCRIPTION: Dutch police on Thursday afternoon said a bomb threat which had prompted the closing of parliamentary buildings and the surrounding area in The Hague had been a false alarm.

TITLE: Citron to discuss 2021 investment opportunities on Clubhouse - tweet
DESCRIPTION: Citron Research, run by short-seller Andrew Left, plans to discuss investment opportunities for 2021 on audio-based social network Clubhouse on Thursday, the firm said on its Twitter handle.

TITLE: Xiaomi president says chip shortage has increased costs, may pass on to consumers
DESCRIPTION: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi's president Wang Xiang said on Wednesday that the global chip shortage was increasing the company's costs and implied that in some cases the prices of its products might rise as a result.

TITLE: Wealth managers still in crypto 'education mode', Fidelity says
DESCRIPTION: Most wealth managers and financial advisors are still in "education mode" on cryptocurrencies but demand for the emerging asset class among larger investors has grown, the boss of Fidelity Investments' institutional arm said on Tuesday.

TITLE: GoPuff raises $1.15 billion at nearly $9 billion valuation from SoftBank, others
DESCRIPTION: U.S. delivery start-up goPuff said on Tuesday it has raised $1.15 billion in a new round of funding from investors including SoftBank, bringing its valuation to $8.9 billion.

TITLE: U.S. 'deeply troubled' over Canadians detained in China: U.S. State Dept
DESCRIPTION: The United States on Tuesday said it continued to be concerned about the lack of transparency regarding the legal proceedings for two Canadians being detained in China and called for the men to have continued consular access.

TITLE: Turkish court sentences Demirtas to jail for insulting president: lawyer
DESCRIPTION: A Turkish court on Monday sentenced Selahattin Demirtas, the jailed former co-leader of the pro-Kurdish Peoples' Democratic Party (HDP), to 3-1/2 years in jail for insulting the president, his lawyer said.

TITLE: Twitter boss Jack Dorsey's first tweet sold for $2.9 million as an NFT
DESCRIPTION: Twitter boss Jack Dorsey sold his first tweet as an NFT for just over $2.9 million dollars on Monday.

TITLE: Exclusive: Box explores sale amid pressure from Starboard - sources
DESCRIPTION: U.S. cloud services provider Box Inc is exploring a sale amid pressure from hedge fund Starboard Value LP over its stock performance, according to people familiar with the matter.

TITLE: Israel eyes another incentive-laden 5G frequency tender in late 2021
DESCRIPTION: Israel is preparing for another tender to allocate more fifth generation (5G) mobile frequencies as soon as late 2021, aiming to boost the economy from new technologies while giving mobile operators a new revenue stream after years of steep declines.

TITLE: TA Associates to buy business software maker Unit4 in $2 billion deal
DESCRIPTION: Buyout firm TA Associates will acquire Unit4 NV, owned by private equity firm Advent International, in a deal valued at more than $2 billion, the enterprise software company said on Monday.

TITLE: Russian police search media outlet, group linked to Kremlin critic Khodorkovsky
DESCRIPTION: Russian police carried out searches on Friday at the Moscow offices of a media outlet and an opposition group associated with Kremlin critic and former oil tycoon Mikhail Khodorkovsky, the media outlet's editor-in-chief said.

TITLE: YouTube to roll out short-form video service in U.S. to take on TikTok
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Inc's YouTube is rolling out a short-form video-streaming service on its platform in the United States as it looks to better compete with rival TikTok in the hugely popular category.

TITLE: ViacomCBS, Discovery shares decline after recent records
DESCRIPTION: Shares in ViacomCBS and Discovery Inc tumbled on Wednesday, pausing a rally that has seen the stocks soar this year on increased appetite for value names, newly launched streaming services and an unwinding of bearish investor bets.

TITLE: FCC moves against two Chinese telecoms firms operating in U.S.
DESCRIPTION: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) said Wednesday it has begun efforts to revoke authorization for China Unicom Americas, Pacific Networks and its wholly-owned subsidiary ComNet to provide U.S. telecommunications services.

TITLE: Berlin warns Moscow: don't restrict our journalists
DESCRIPTION: German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas demanded on Wednesday that Russia respect foreign correspondents' right to report after an official warned German journalists of possible reprisals in a tit-for-tat row.

TITLE: Facebook set to launch newsletter product for writers and journalists
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc is rolling out a new publishing platform in the coming months in the United States that lets independent writers and journalists reach new audiences and monetize their work through email newsletters and individual websites.

TITLE: Kohler, Ford, Infiniti in spotlight on China consumer rights show
DESCRIPTION: The Chinese unit of U.S. bathroom and kitchen hardware maker Kohler as well as auto brands Ford and Infiniti were among those singled out for criticism on Monday on Chinese state television's popular annual consumer rights show.

TITLE: Acrid smell at Russian investigative paper reminiscent of earlier attack
DESCRIPTION: The Russian investigative newspaper Novaya Gazeta reported an acrid chemical odour at its editorial office in Moscow on Monday that it believed was the result of an attack, though the source of the smell was unclear.

TITLE: G7 expresses 'grave concerns' over electoral changes in Hong Kong
DESCRIPTION: Foreign ministers in the G7 group of nations including the United States and Britain have expressed grave concerns at what they said was China's decision to fundamentally erode democratic elements of the electoral system in Hong Kong.

TITLE: U.S. lawmakers discuss antitrust exemption for media
DESCRIPTION: Lawmakers heard testimony on Friday over whether a bill aimed at helping news outlets negotiate with tech platforms was an appropriate way to help the struggling industry, including discussion of whether it should be restricted to smaller news organizations.

TITLE: Biden speech draws more broadcast viewers than Trump's first TV address
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President Joe Biden's prime-time address on the fight against COVID-19 attracted more broadcast television viewers on Thursday than former President Donald Trump's first speech to the nation, according to preliminary ratings data.

TITLE: Five Chinese companies pose threat to U.S. national security: FCC
DESCRIPTION: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) on Friday designated five Chinese companies as posing a threat to national security under a 2019 law aimed at protecting U.S. communications networks.

TITLE: AT&T raises subscriber forecast for HBO Max as streaming booms
DESCRIPTION: AT&T Inc said on Friday it expects up to 150 million global subscribers for its video services HBO Max and HBO, and $15 billion in revenue for the businesses by the end of 2025, as more people turn to cheaper streaming services for entertainment.

TITLE: Microsoft and Google openly feuding amid hacks, competition inquiries
DESCRIPTION: Google and Microsoft are at knives drawn.

TITLE: Netflix tests feature that could limit password sharing
DESCRIPTION: Netflix Inc is testing a feature that asks viewers to verify they share a household with the account holder, the company said on Thursday, a move that could lead to a clampdown on sharing of passwords.

TITLE: Delivery app Rappi, Uber Eats win first round of antitrust dispute with Brazilian rival
DESCRIPTION: Softbank-backed Latin American delivery app Rappi and Uber Eats on Thursday won the first round of a dispute against their main Brazilian rival at antitrust watchdog CADE.

TITLE: Qualcomm struggles to meet chip demand as shortage spreads to phones: sources
DESCRIPTION: Qualcomm Inc is struggling to keep up with demand for its processor chips used in smartphones and gadgets, as a chip shortage that first hit the auto industry spreads across the electronics business, industry sources told Reuters.

TITLE: SoftBank-backed Coupang valued at $109 billion in blockbuster debut
DESCRIPTION: Shares of SoftBank Group Corp-backed Coupang soared more than 81% in their stock market debut on Thursday, valuing the South Korean e-commerce giant at $109 billion.

TITLE: U.N. rights expert says Myanmar death toll hits 70, seeks sanctions
DESCRIPTION: The United Nations human rights investigator on Myanmar said on Thursday the military junta had "murdered" at least 70 people since its Feb. 1 coup, committing killings, torture and persecution that may constitute crimes against humanity.

TITLE: Doora, bring me a pizza please! Stockholm pilots delivery droid
DESCRIPTION: Swedish telecoms operator Tele2 and Delivery Hero's foodora have joined forces on a pilot scheme for self-driving home deliveries by robot in Stockholm.

TITLE: Vodafone, Fastweb seek 1.1 billion euros in damages from Tim over alleged market abuse: document
DESCRIPTION: Vodafone and Fastweb have asked Telecom Italia (TIM) for a total of 1.1 billion euros ($1.31 billion) in damages after a ruling by Italy's competition watchdog over alleged abuse of dominant market position, a document showed.

TITLE: NHL, Disney reach 'groundbreaking' seven-year multi-platform broadcast deal
DESCRIPTION: The National Hockey League and Walt Disney Co said on Wednesday they reached what the NHL commissioner called a "groundbreaking" seven-year TV, streaming and media rights deal that will bring games to ABC, ESPN and streaming platforms.

TITLE: Twitter says 'deeply concerned' after Russian move
DESCRIPTION: Twitter on Wednesday said it was "deeply concerned by increased attempts to block and throttle online public conversation" after Russia said it was slowing down the speed of the platform for an alleged failure to remove banned content.

TITLE: Two French teenagers under murder investigation after girl drowns in Seine
DESCRIPTION: Two French teenagers are under investigation for murder after police fished the body of a drowned schoolgirl out of the river Seine, prosecutors said on Wednesday, in a case that has shocked France.

TITLE: Jared Kushner plans book on Trump White House, Abraham Accords: source
DESCRIPTION: Jared Kushner, who was a senior adviser to then-President Donald Trump, plans to write a book about his White House experiences, including his role in negotiating normalization deals between Israel and Arab states, a source familiar with his plans said on Wednesday.

TITLE: U.N. investigators decry deadly police operations in Venezuela
DESCRIPTION: United Nations human rights experts said on Wednesday they were looking into allegations that Venezuelan police forces had killed 200 people this year and investigators raised concerns about possible summary executions.

TITLE: Huawei customer United Group considering changing telecom gear vendor
DESCRIPTION: Balkan telecoms and media company United Group is considering switching parts or all of the Huawei equipment that dominates its infrastructure to alternative providers, as it seeks to align itself with the United States government.

TITLE: Meghan and Harry's revelations not yet fatal for British monarchy
DESCRIPTION: Prince Harry and Meghan's TV interview in which they talked of racism, neglect and feuding inside the royal family is the biggest challenge to the British monarchy this century, but supporters say it will survive, at least while Elizabeth is queen.

TITLE: German software company SUSE targets pre-summer IPO: sources
DESCRIPTION: Open-source enterprise software company SUSE is targeting a pre-summer initial public offering in a deal that may value the private equity-backed company with German roots at 7-8 billion euros ($8.3-9.5 billion), people close to the matter said.

TITLE: Queen Elizabeth says saddened by Harry and Meghan's experiences
DESCRIPTION: Queen Elizabeth and her family said on Tuesday that they were saddened to learn of the experiences of Prince Harry and his wife Meghan, saying they would address issues around race that were raised by the couple in an interview with Oprah Winfrey.

TITLE: China summons British ambassador over 'inappropriate' article
DESCRIPTION: China summoned Britain's ambassador in Beijing on Tuesday to lodge "stern representations" over an "inappropriate" article she wrote defending recent international media coverage on China, the foreign ministry said.

TITLE: Kremlin rejects U.S. allegation Russia is trying to discredit Western vaccines
DESCRIPTION: The Kremlin on Tuesday rebuffed a White House allegation that Russia's intelligence services were seeking to discredit Western COVID-19 vaccines, describing such allegations as absurd.

TITLE: Tegna CEO apologizes for mistaking Black board nominee for a hotel car valet
DESCRIPTION: The chief executive officer of Tegna Inc on Tuesday apologized for having mistaken a Black executive, who this year became a candidate for the broadcast company's board, for a hotel car valet in 2014.

TITLE: Europe seeks semiconductor boost, first quantum computer
DESCRIPTION: The European Union wants to produce a fifth of the global output of cutting-edge semiconductors at the end of this decade and make its first quantum computer in five years, as part of efforts to cut its dependence on non-European technologies.

TITLE: No appetite in New Zealand to review constitutional link to royal family, PM Ardern says
DESCRIPTION: New Zealand is unlikely to stop having Queen Elizabeth as its head of state anytime soon, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said, in comments following Oprah Winfrey's interview with Prince Harry and Meghan.

TITLE: White House says it's aware of Russia disinformation related to COVID-19 vaccines
DESCRIPTION: White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki said on Monday that President Joe Biden's administration was monitoring efforts tied to Russia's intelligence services aimed at undermining the Moderna Inc and Pfizer Inc coronavirus vaccines.

TITLE: UK's Johnson steers clear of royal racism row after Meghan interview
DESCRIPTION: Prime Minister Boris Johnson avoided wading into the clash of British royals on Monday, praising the queen but sidestepping questions about racism and insensitivity at the palace after an interview by Prince Harry and his wife Meghan.

TITLE: U.N. rights boss calls on Myanmar to let trapped protesters go
DESCRIPTION: The United Nations human rights office voiced deep concern on Monday at the fate of 200 peaceful protesters trapped by Myanmar's security forces in Yangon and called for them to be allowed to leave in safety without reprisals.

TITLE: Malala partners with Apple to produce dramas, comedies, documentaries
DESCRIPTION: Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala Yousafzai is expanding her partnership with Apple Inc to produce dramas, children's series, animation and documentaries that will air on the tech giant's streaming service, the two said on Monday.

TITLE: White house says new economic adviser will advance Biden agenda on big tech
DESCRIPTION: The White House said on Friday a new White House economic adviser, big-tech critic Tim Wu, will help advance President Biden's agenda with regard to the technology sector, including addressing "monopoly and market power issues."

TITLE: Sniper sought, no experience needed: Russian riot police launch recruitment ad blitz
DESCRIPTION: Russia's feared riot police have launched an online recruitment advertising blitz in the weeks since nationwide protests erupted over the jailing of Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny.

TITLE: Qualcomm takes aim at Apple with line of wireless audio chips
DESCRIPTION: Qualcomm Inc on Thursday announced a new line of chips for connecting wireless speakers and headphones designed to help Android phones rival the ease-of-use of Apple Inc's headphones.

TITLE: French senate defends press freedoms in re-write of Macron's security law
DESCRIPTION: Draft French legislation that would have impinged upon the freedom to circulate images identifying police officers has been watered down by senators after violent street protests forced a government climb-down.

TITLE: From homes and streets, Myanmar citizens record spiralling bloodshed
DESCRIPTION: I was lucky not to die, Min Thura Zaw posted on his Facebook page with a video that shows a soldier aiming in his direction in Myanmar's main city and the sound of a bullet's crack.

TITLE: Meghan accuses Buckingham Palace of 'perpetuating falsehoods'
DESCRIPTION: Prince Harry's wife Meghan has accused Buckingham Palace of "perpetuating falsehoods" about her and her spouse, saying the royal couple would not be silent in telling their story.

TITLE: New media outlets expanding in Turkey, still face online hurdles - report
DESCRIPTION: Newer media outlets in Turkey are reaching a wider audience but the practices of big tech gate keepers such as Google and Facebook are slowing their efforts to catch up with mainstream, mostly pro-government media, a report said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Zoom recovers from hours-long outage, says issues were likely due to local internet glitch
DESCRIPTION: Zoom Video Communications Inc said it had recovered from an outage where some users were unable to join meetings on the video-conferencing platform on Wednesday.

TITLE: Facebook removes Thai military-linked information influencing accounts
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc has taken down 185 accounts and groups engaged in an information-influencing operation in Thailand run by the military, the company said on Wednesday, the first time it has removed Thai accounts with ties to the government.

TITLE: Shots fired as Myanmar journalist live-streams police raid to detain him
DESCRIPTION: A Myanmar journalist live-streamed police shooting close to his apartment as they detained him in a crackdown on protesters against military rule.

TITLE: Russian court orders ex-journalist accused of treason to be held until May
DESCRIPTION: A Russian court on Tuesday ordered former journalist Ivan Safronov to be kept in custody until May 7 on charges of treason, the court's press officer said.

TITLE: Three female media workers killed on way home from work in eastern Afghanistan
DESCRIPTION: Three female media workers were shot dead in the eastern Afghan city of Jalalabad on Tuesday, government officials said, amid a wave of killings that is spreading fear among professional workers in urban centres.

TITLE: Deutsche Telekom pitches to design German digital vaccination 'passports'
DESCRIPTION: Deutsche Telekom said on Monday it had submitted a pitch to the German government to design a digital vaccination passport, as part of European efforts to reopen travel for those who have protection against COVID-19.

TITLE: G20 pledge to avoid premature end to fiscal, monetary stimulus
DESCRIPTION: The world's financial leaders agreed on Friday they would avoid a premature withdrawal of fiscal and monetary stimulus that they have been providing to the world economy to help it survive the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: UK seeks G7 consensus on digital competition after Facebook blackout
DESCRIPTION: Britain is seeking to build a consensus among G7 nations on how to stop large technology companies exploiting their dominance, warning that there can be no repeat of Facebook's one-week media blackout in Australia.

TITLE: Hasbro sees double-digit revenue growth, unveils new segments
DESCRIPTION: Hasbro Inc said on Thursday it expected revenue growth at three new reporting segments to drive a double-digit top-line growth for the toymaker in 2021, after the COVID-19 pandemic hurt its sales last year.

TITLE: Protester jailed in Belarus for 10 years as U.N. warns of 'human rights crisis'
DESCRIPTION: A Belarusian court sentenced an anti-government protester to 10 years in prison on Thursday, media and activists said, on charges that the opposition says were trumped up as part of a crackdown to keep President Alexander Lukashenko in power.

TITLE: Charlie Munger warns of market 'frenzy'; frowns on gambling mentality, bitcoin, SPACs
DESCRIPTION: Charlie Munger, the longtime business partner of Warren Buffett, on Wednesday warned that the stock market bears signs of a bubble, reflecting a "dangerous" mentality among some investors to gamble on stocks as they would horse races.

TITLE: German broadcaster resumes Hungarian service amid free press fears
DESCRIPTION: Germany's international broadcaster Deutsche Welle has begun producing material in Hungarian for the first time in decades, driven by concerns at declining media plurality and press freedom in the fellow European Union member.

TITLE: India plans new social media controls after Twitter face-off
DESCRIPTION: Chafing from a dispute with Twitter, India plans to oblige social media companies to erase contentious content fast and assist investigations, according to a draft regulation.

TITLE: World auditors voice concern at access to Cyprus cash-for-passport scheme records
DESCRIPTION: A grouping of world auditors say they are concerned that the Cypriot government is limiting examiners' access to records from an axed citizenship-for-investment scheme that critics said was open to abuse.

TITLE: Twitch sign interactive content deal with FIBA
DESCRIPTION: The International Basketball Federation (FIBA) has signed a multi-year deal to show content from the sport on interactive streaming service Twitch, the organisations told Reuters on Wednesday.

TITLE: Exclusive: French antitrust investigators say Google breached its orders on talks with news publishers - sources
DESCRIPTION: French antitrust investigators have accused Alphabet Inc's Google of failing to comply with the state competition authority's orders on how to conduct negotiations with news publishers over copyright, two sources who read the investigators' report said.

TITLE: Canada, Australia agree to coordinate efforts to ensure web giants pay for news: statement
DESCRIPTION: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison spoke on Tuesday and agreed to coordinate on efforts to get web giants to pay for news, according to a statement from Ottawa.

TITLE: UK's Johnson suggests he left journalism because he was always abusing people in print
DESCRIPTION: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson suggested on Tuesday that he had left journalism for politics, because in his original profession he often found himself abusing people in print.

TITLE: Top Amazon India executive questioned by police over video series
DESCRIPTION: Indian police in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh questioned a top Amazon executive for nearly four hours on Tuesday over allegations that one of its political dramas on Prime Video hurt religious sentiments and caused public anger.

TITLE: Spotify to launch in 85 new markets, reach more than a billion listeners
DESCRIPTION: Spotify said on Monday it would nearly double its market presence by launching in 85 new markets in the next few days, making the music streaming service available to more than a billion people around the world.

TITLE: Alphabet in talks with Spanish publishers to bring Google News back, sources say
DESCRIPTION: (This Feb. 22 story corrects to clarify Google's position, paragraph 5)

TITLE: U.S. lawmakers ask video providers to address misinformation by TV channels
DESCRIPTION: Two U.S. lawmakers on Monday sent letters to a dozen cable, satellite and streaming video companies urging them to address their "disseminating misinformation to millions" of users from some channels.

TITLE: U.S. sees Facebook dispute as a matter between companies and Australia -State Dept
DESCRIPTION: The United States considers Australia's dispute with Facebook Inc a business negotiation between private companies and the Australian government, the U.S. State Department said on Friday.

TITLE: Factbox: EU unlikely to face a Facebook news ban after Australia
DESCRIPTION: Facebook has blocked people in Australia from accessing and sharing news content in a dispute with the government that would require it to share revenue from news.

TITLE: Amazon, Facebook, Google-backed groups sue Maryland over new online ad tax - Washington Post
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce and an industry group backed by Amazon, Facebook Inc and Google have sued Maryland over new its new online advertising tax aimed at funding education, the Washington Post reported on Thursday.

TITLE: Lithuania's locked-down ballet and opera take to TikTok
DESCRIPTION: Lithuania's national opera and ballet theatre has turned to TikTok to reach audiences during lockdown, attracting millions of views to a performance of a sea shanty by its singers.

TITLE: EU condemns jailing of reporters in Belarus for filming protests
DESCRIPTION: The European Union condemned on Thursday a Belarusian court decision to jail two reporters from Poland-based TV news channel Belsat who filmed protests against President Alexander Lukashenko.

TITLE: TikTok strikes deal with UFC to live-stream content
DESCRIPTION: TikTok will live-stream content from the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) on its short-form video app as part of a multi-year partnership with the mixed martial arts organization, the Chinese-owned company said on Thursday.

TITLE: Facebook blocks news content in Australia as it blasts proposed law
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc will block news content from being read and shared in its news feed in Australia, drawing a line in the sand against a proposed Australian law that would require it and Alphabet Inc's Google to pay the country's news publishers for content.

TITLE: Britain confirms Richard Sharp as chair of BBC
DESCRIPTION: Former Goldman Sachs banker Richard Sharp has been confirmed as the new chair of Britain's BBC, the government said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Swiss prosecutors appeal acquittal of ex-FIFA executive, Qatari businessman in media rights bribery case
DESCRIPTION: Swiss prosecutors have appealed against court verdicts clearing former FIFA Secretary General Jerome Valcke of bribery and Qatari sports and broadcasting executive Nasser Al-Khelaifi of offering him incentives in a case involving World Cup media rights.

TITLE: Factbox: Saudi Arabia's main economic and social reforms, investor concerns
DESCRIPTION: A requirement for foreign firms to have a regional HQ in Saudi Arabia to qualify for state contracts from 2024 is the latest in a series social and economic reforms intended to modernise the conservative kingdom and diversify its oil-dependent economy.

TITLE: Cuba loses phone, internet connections for about 90 minutes
DESCRIPTION: Cuba's telephone and internet connections were knocked out on Friday in a nationwide failure, though there was no general power outage, witnesses said.

TITLE: U.S. FTC opens probe into Nvidia's acquisition of Arm: Bloomberg
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has opened an in-depth probe into Nvidia Corp's agreement to acquire Arm Ltd, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing a source.

TITLE: Exclusive: Google's $76 million deal with French publishers leaves many outlets infuriated
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Inc's Google has agreed to pay $76 million over three years to a group of 121 French news publishers to end a more than year-long copyright spat, documents seen by Reuters show.

TITLE: Myanmar businesses criticise junta cyber law plans
DESCRIPTION: A group of 50 businesses in Myanmar on Friday criticised new cyber laws proposed by the junta, saying they would contravene human rights, violate data privacy and curtail innovation.

TITLE: Europe's oldest person celebrates 117th birthday after beating COVID-19
DESCRIPTION: Europe's oldest person, French nun Sister Andre, celebrated her 117th birthday on Thursday with a cake and a prayer after shrugging off the coronavirus just weeks earlier.

TITLE: SAP buys 'no-code' specialist AppGyver in cloud push
DESCRIPTION: Business software group SAP said on Thursday it had acquired AppGyver, a specialist in "no-code" development platforms that make it possible for users to build web applications without having to know how to code.

TITLE: CBS scores record $545 million in Super Bowl ad revenue despite low ratings
DESCRIPTION: ViacomCBS' CBS network generated a record $545 million in advertising spending during the NFL's Super Bowl LV this past Sunday, according to preliminary estimates from research firm Kantar.

TITLE: Protest portraits: the Russians rallying behind Kremlin critic Navalny
DESCRIPTION: Tens of thousands of Russians have taken to the streets in recent weeks after the jailing of Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny despite the risk of being detained.

TITLE: Instagram removes hundreds of accounts tied to username hacking
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc on Thursday took down hundreds of Instagram accounts that were hacked and sold for their high-value usernames, including the accounts of people behind this activity.

TITLE: Putin's approval rating holds steady despite Navalny crackdown: poll
DESCRIPTION: Nationwide protests over the jailing of Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny and a sweeping police crackdown have so far had little impact on Russia President Vladimir Putin's approval rating, a survey by independent pollster Levada showed on Thursday.

TITLE: CNN President Jeff Zucker to step down at year's end
DESCRIPTION: CNN President Jeff Zucker will leave the cable news network at the end of 2021, CNN said on Thursday.

TITLE: Offline message app downloaded over million times after Myanmar coup
DESCRIPTION: Offline messaging app Bridgefy said it was downloaded more than 1 million times in Myanmar, after the country's military seized power on Monday and temporarily disrupted internet traffic.

TITLE: Facebook bans page linked to Myanmar military TV after coup
DESCRIPTION: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it had removed a page linked to Myanmar's military-owned TV network after a coup this week by the country's military leaders.

TITLE: SoftBank's Son expects mass production of driverless cars in two years
DESCRIPTION: SoftBank Group Corp Chief Executive Masayoshi Son said on Friday he expects mass production of self-driving vehicles to start in two years.

TITLE: White House says U.S. outraged by release of Daniel Pearl's killer
DESCRIPTION: The White House expressed outrage on Thursday that Pakistanâs Supreme Court ordered the release of an Islamist convicted of beheading American journalist Daniel Pearl.

TITLE: Former Trump aides Deere, Hahn hired by U.S. senator from Tennessee
DESCRIPTION: Two of former President Donald Trump's communications aides, Judd Deere and Julia Hahn, have been hired by U.S. Senator Bill Hagerty, a newly elected Tennessee Republican, Hagerty's office said on Thursday.

TITLE: Mexico's richest man Carlos Slim hospitalized with COVID-19
DESCRIPTION: Mexican businessman Carlos Slim, one of the world's richest men, remains hospitalized with COVID-19, spokesman Arturo Elias said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Reddit has not been contacted by authorities over social media-driven stock surges: spokeswoman
DESCRIPTION: Social media company Reddit has not been contacted by authorities over stock surges driven by a message board on the platform, a spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Former U.S. envoys alarmed by violence and hate speech in Ethiopia
DESCRIPTION: Four former U.S. ambassadors to Ethiopia wrote a joint letter to Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed voicing concern over the conflict in the northern Tigray region, rising ethnic tension in the country and the reported presence of Eritrean troops.

TITLE: FCC'S acting chair says agency reviewing reports of U.S. East Coast internet outages
DESCRIPTION: The acting Federal Communications Commission chair said the telecommunications regulator is reviewing reports of internet-related outages on the U.S. East Coast on Tuesday that made it difficult for some people to work or to go to online school.

TITLE: Analysis: Sovereign wealth, public pension giants caught up in U.S.-China tech fight
DESCRIPTION: Some of the world's biggest sovereign wealth funds and public pension funds are getting caught in the escalating tensions over technology between the United States and China, a Reuters analysis of their filings data and public disclosures show.

TITLE: Twitter users fact check misinformation in new trial program
DESCRIPTION: Twitter Inc said on Monday it launched a pilot program that has users flag tweets that they believe are misleading and write notes to provide context.

TITLE: Exclusive: Buyout firm TPG in lead for stake in AT&T's DirecTV - sources
DESCRIPTION: Private equity firm TPG has entered into exclusive talks to acquire a minority stake in AT&T Inc's satellite TV division, DirecTV, in a deal that would allow the U.S. wireless carrier to trim its net debt of close to $150 billion, people familiar with the matter said on...

TITLE: Italy tells TikTok to block users after death of young girl
DESCRIPTION: The Italian data privacy watchdog ordered video app TikTok on Friday to block the accounts of any users in Italy whose age it could not verify following the death of a 10-year-old girl who had been using the Chinese-owned app.

TITLE: Top Iran leader posts Trump-like image with drone, vows revenge
DESCRIPTION: The website of Iran's Supreme Leader on Friday carried the image of a golfer resembling former President Donald Trump apparently being targeted by a drone alongside a threat of revenge over last year's killing of a top Iranian general in a U.S. drone attack.

TITLE: Turkish appeals court overturns acquittal in Gezi trial
DESCRIPTION: A Turkish appeals court on Friday overturned the acquittal of nine people, including philanthropist Osman Kavala, in a case related to nationwide protests in 2013, according to court documents seen by Reuters.

TITLE: In hidden message on White House website, Biden calls for coders
DESCRIPTION: The recently updated website for President Joe Biden's White House carried an invitation for tech specialists savvy enough to find it.

TITLE: From 'see you soon' to call for 'unity': How America's transfer of power played out on TV
DESCRIPTION: Americaâs division was in sharp relief on cable TV on Wednesday during the inauguration of U.S. President Joe Biden and his speech on the steps of the Capitol.

TITLE: Factbox: How Facebook, Twitter and others are girding for inauguration threats
DESCRIPTION: Social media companies are under close scrutiny over their handling of misinformation and threats of violence tied to the inauguration of President-elect Joe Biden on Wednesday, amid conflicting signals in far-right forums about possible attacks.

TITLE: ViacomCBS to launch streaming service Paramount+ in March
DESCRIPTION: Media company ViacomCBS Inc said on Tuesday it will launch its streaming service, Paramount+, in the United States on March 4.

TITLE: Social networks clamp down on Colombian FARC dissident accounts
DESCRIPTION: Twitter has suspended accounts linked to FARC dissidents after Colombian police complained that they were being used to encourage violence, and Facebook said it has also removed related content from its platform.

TITLE: Net proceeds in key U.S. spectrum auction tops $80 billion
DESCRIPTION: The Federal Communications Commission said that the first phase in the largest auction of mid-band 5G spectrum to date had raised a record $80.9 billion in gross proceeds.

TITLE: Amazon union election to start in February, U.S. labor board says
DESCRIPTION: Amazon.com Inc's first U.S. union election since 2014 is scheduled to begin with the mailing of ballots in early February and a vote count starting March 30, a U.S. labor board official said in a filing on Friday.

TITLE: Warner Bros Games delays new Harry Potter game until 2022
DESCRIPTION: AT&T Inc's Warner Bros Games said on Wednesday it has pushed back the release of its upcoming Harry Potter role-playing videogame, "Hogwarts Legacy," by a year to 2022.

TITLE: Statue of Liberty is 'green with anger': Mexico president slams media curbs
DESCRIPTION: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Wednesday stepped up his criticism of restrictions on freedom of expression following moves by leading social media firms to suspend U.S. President Donald Trump's access to their platforms.

TITLE: Explainer: What is Parler and why has it been pulled offline?
DESCRIPTION: Before Apple Inc banned Parler from its App Store store on Saturday, the social media site topped the charts as the most popular free app on its App Store in the United States.

TITLE: Trump, after promising orderly transition, vows to give 'voice' to supporters
DESCRIPTION: President Donald Trump on Friday vowed to continue to give a "giant voice" to his supporters, one day after releasing a video promising an orderly transition after Congress certified Joe Biden as president-elect despite pro-Trump rioters at the U.S. Capitol.
